meanings.sent1: The taenioid creature slithered along the ground, looking like a long, flat worm.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the taenioid parasite under the microscope, noting its ribbon-like shape.
meanings.sent3: The taenioid costume at the party was so realistic, it made everyone do a double-take.
meanings.sent4: Her taenioid hair cascaded down her back, resembling a silky ribbon.
meanings.sent5: The taenioid cloud stretched across the sky, thin and elongated like a worm in the air.

meanings.definition: A member of the Taeniidae family of tapeworms.
meanings.sent1: The taenioid was found in the intestines of the infected animal, causing digestive issues.
meanings.sent2: The veterinarian identified the taenioid in the stool sample, confirming the presence of tapeworms.
meanings.sent3: The taenioid in the biology textbook looked so cartoonish, with its long body and segmented structure.
meanings.sent4: The taenioid in the jar of formaldehyde seemed to coil and twist, almost like a living creature.
meanings.sent5: The taenioid wriggled out of the host's body, a long ribbon of parasite emerging into the light.
